property.name: text
property.value: Emulate a watch, transmit the data via UDP, read the data and plot it.

property.name: text
property.value: Listen for messages.

property.name: runCommand
property.value: node nodeHostInvoke.js -timeout 2000 hosts/node/@modelName@

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Christopher Brooks. Based on TestUDPSocketSelf.xml by Edward A. Lee, Elizabeth Osyk

property.name: text

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor sends UDP (datagram) messages to the specified destination address and port.

The send type can be any of those supported by the host. The list of supported types will be provided as options for the sendType parameter. For the Ptolemy II host, these include at least 'string', 'number', 'image', and a variety of numeric types.

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim and Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: UDPSocketSender.js 962 2016-09-27 01:00:18Z cxh $$

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: toSend (port)
property.value: The message to send.

property.name: destinationAddress (port)
property.value: The host name or IP address to send to. This defaults to "localhost".

property.name: destinationPort (port)
property.value: The port to send to. This defaults to 8084.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks. Based on TestSpontaneous by Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: TestSpontaneous.js 546 2016-02-03 02:07:57Z cxh $$

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval before the output in milliseconds.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
Compare the input with a known good input.

This actor is based on the NonStrictTest actor, but currently only handles numeric and string input.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: TrainableTest.js 940 2016-09-03 01:12:46Z cxh $$

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: script
script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
Read UDP gesture data from a Moto 360 watch.

See https://github.com/Zziwei/GestureUDP for software for the watch.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks

property.name: listeningAddress (port)
property.value: The interface to listen on for incoming messages. This defaults to "0.0.0.0", which means to listen on all network interfaces.

property.name: listeningPort (port)
property.value: The port to listen on for incoming messages. This defaults to 4567, which is the value found in https://github.com/Zziwei/PackageSendTest

property.name: message (port)
property.value: The received message.

property.name: listening (port)
property.value: True to indicate that listening has begun, false to indicate that it has stopped.

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor
